rules.natural: If Leo has the medical condition arthritis, then it is not the case that Leo's arthritis condition is monitored.
Provided that Leo is scheduled for treatment in the afternoon, then whenever the sanctuary is not under normal operations, Leo has indoor access to the medical wing.
Leo's physical therapy treatment being verified implies that it is documented.
Artwork being displayed in the sanctuary's main hall leads to it being rotated.
Whenever artwork is displayed in the sanctuary's main hall, it is maintained.
If artwork is displayed in the sanctuary's main hall, then it is not the case that the artwork is rotated.
Either artwork is displayed in the sanctuary's main hall, or if the sanctuary is not under normal operations, then Leo requires pain reliever medication.
The sanctuary issuing a monthly report ensures that the report is published on the website.
The sanctuary issuing a monthly report necessitates that a regulatory report is filed.
Either the sanctuary issues a monthly report or it issues an annual report.
If the sanctuary issues an annual report, then in the event that the sanctuary is not under normal operations, the facility is not open during public hours.
The board approving the sanctuary's report implies that, provided the sanctuary is not under normal operations, the facility is not open during public hours.
If Leo requires a low-protein special diet, then it is not the case that it is approved by a veterinarian.
Either Leo requires a low-protein special diet or he does not have the medical condition arthritis.

Either Leo's arthritis condition is stable, or if Leo has the medical condition arthritis, then his condition is monitored.

Either Leo is required to be indoors in the medical wing, or if the sanctuary is not under normal operations, then his outdoor access to the main yard is restricted.
The director reviewing Leo's medical case implies that, should the medical director approve his confinement, then he is not required to be indoors in the medical wing.
